title: How to Make a Sling for an Umbrella

steps.headline: Cut a length of cord about two umbrellas long.
Apply heat to one tip of the cord using a lighter.
steps.description:
Do this very carefully––watch closely to check that the tip is slowly melting and stop before you make an unsightly blob. Mind you don't get a bad burn while the cord tip is hot. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/02\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/02\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Stop when it is neatly melted.
steps.description: This hard tip will prevent the sheath and the inner part of the cord from fraying when you make the small loop for the tip of the umbrella.

steps.headline: Make a small loop at the sealed end of the rope.
steps.description: This will hold the tip of the umbrella firmly in place.

steps.headline: Insert the umbrella's tip through the small loop you've just made.
steps.description: Tighten the cord and fold it sharply at the tip of the handle of the umbrella. The length of the free end of the cord should be about a third of the umbrella's length. Cut and melt tip as explained above.

steps.headline: Fold the double cord very tightly.
Done.
steps.description: You can now tote or hang the umbrella with ease.

tyn: A suitable length of cord, at least two umbrella lengths long
text:
Preparing the cord Cut a length of cord about two umbrellas long. Apply heat to one tip of the cord using a lighter. Do this very carefully––watch closely to check that the tip is slowly melting and stop before you make an unsightly blob. Mind you don't get a bad burn while the cord tip is hot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Stop when it is neatly melted. This hard tip will prevent the sheath and the inner part of the cord from fraying when you make the small loop for the tip of the umbrella. Fixing the Rope Make a small loop at the sealed end of the rope. This will hold the tip of the umbrella firmly in place. Insert the umbrella's tip through the small loop you've just made. Tighten the cord and fold it sharply at the tip of the handle of the umbrella. The length of the free end of the cord should be about a third of the umbrella's length. Cut and melt tip as explained above. Fold the double cord very tightly. Push hard to open the passage in the cord-lock and push the double cord firmly through this, so that you get an adjustable loop. Attach it to the handle of your umbrella. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make a single knot at the very tip of the free end of the cord to secure everything in place, while adjusting or when pocketing the sling in case of rain. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Done. You can now tote or hang the umbrella with ease.
sentences: Preparing the cord Cut a length of cord about two umbrellas long.
Apply heat to one tip of the cord using a lighter.
Do this very carefully––watch closely to check that the tip is slowly melting and stop before you make an unsightly blob.
Mind you don't get a bad burn while the cord tip is hot.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/02\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/02\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Stop when it is neatly melted.
This hard tip will prevent the sheath and the inner part of the cord from fraying when you make the small loop for the tip of the umbrella.
Fixing the Rope Make a small loop at the sealed end of the rope.
This will hold the tip of the umbrella firmly in place.
Insert the umbrella's tip through the small loop you've just made.
Tighten the cord and fold it sharply at the tip of the handle of the umbrella.
The length of the free end of the cord should be about a third of the umbrella's length.
Cut and melt tip as explained above.
Fold the double cord very tightly.
Push hard to open the passage in the cord-lock and push the double cord firmly through this, so that you get an adjustable loop.
Attach it to the handle of your umbrella.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Make a single knot at the very tip of the free end of the cord to secure everything in place, while adjusting or when pocketing the sling in case of rain.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Sling-for-an-Umbrella-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Done.
You can now tote or hang the umbrella with ease.
